    Game Jams

    Here is all of the game jams I participated in.

    Shovel Dwarf

    Your character, a dwarf, has to find the exit of each level with the help of power ups.

    TurnCraft

    A Turn-based Tactics game where you can only control which team plays when.

    bio-Mech Love War

    Defend the Heart of your home from the unlikely alliance of mechs and bios!

    ChatnJudge

    A short story game where you must ask question on a chat room system to uncover a major crime. Is the suspect telling the TRUTH or he DAREd to tell a lie?

    A game made only with ui elements and lot of narrative.

    Wayhome

    Island Reign

    A quick story experience where you manage an island by swiping left or right. Don't empty out any of your resources.

    A game jam where I inspired the design on Reigns. Macanicaly and graphicaly simple but I still had issue on one aspect...

    Orbis

    Alter a groundhog day-like universe to save yourself from an alien-invading-timeline-collapsing-paradox by controlling the very essence of matter itself.

    Is there a pixel on that game that is not changed by a custom shader? I made sur there was none!

    Read More 
    Fatal Alchemist

    A silly game where you're the village alchemist, and people come to see you to cure their illnesses. However, you have to figure out their correct ailment and ingredients for the remedy, quickly enough, or the villagers will suffer side effects that cannot be undone.

    A game made in VR with a bigger team of inexperienced jammers.

    Read More 
    Pilot Wave

    Pilot Wave theory is an unpopular Quantum Mechanics interpretation that says particles and waves coexist. A particle surfs on a wave, and its path is predetermined. Our goal is to test this theory. Bring the particle to the speed of light and see what happens!

    My first game where lot of gfx element are powered with shaders. This started my love of shaders. Also, a really well scoped jam.

    Read More 
    Procedural brique texture

    After drawing many brique wall, I wanted to see if I could just make some code to do it, because it's always the same pattern. It's was a great experiment

    Read More 
    Relax and Rain

    We all have our own problems to solve and staying calm and focused is an essential part in solving them. Relax and rain goes back and forth between the world in crisis and one's spirit realm. In order to solve the crisis, the problems of the spirits must be mended. When the body and the mind are in focus and harmony, the solution will be clear.
